Package com.cafean.rpc

Class RPCResponder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.rpc.AbstractRPCConnection
      • com.cafean.rpc.RPCResponder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractServerResponder, CallbackResponder, JobStatusResponder, ModelEditorResponder
    public class RPCResponder
extends AbstractRPCConnection
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is the base class for the server side of an RPC connection. Sub-classes may implement additional methods that make use of processRequest(com.apt.xdr.PibBlock) and sendResponse(com.apt.xdr.PibBlock, int, com.apt.xdr.PibBlock) to communicate with the client side of the connection.

    RPCResponder is responsible for performing the initial handshake procedure with the RPCRequester that manages the client side of the connection.

    The responder includes a thread that manages incomming commands. These incoming commands are processed on this thread. Because of this, the processing of incomming commands should be completed as quickly as possible to prevent any overruns or errors in the socket communication.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RPCResponder

        public RPCResponder​(RPCManager parent,
                    java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String ioPackage,
                    java.net.Socket socket)
        Creates a new RPCResponder to communicate over the given socket.
        Parameters:
        parent - the RPCManager that created this responder
        name - a String containing the name of this responder
        ioPackage - a String containing the path of the package containing the PibBlock classes that will be used as remote commands by this responder.
        socket - the Socket that this responder will use to communicate

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Creates and initializes the responder thread.

      • createCallback

        public CallbackNotifier createCallback​(CallbackAuthorization auth,
                                       RPCResponder oldResponder)
        Creates a callback notifier for the given authorization and responder. Note that the authorization has already been verified at the time that this method is called.

        This base implementation creates a base CallbackNotifier with a LinkedList of PibBlocks as the Queue.

        Sub-class implementations may choose to use a custom notifier extension and/or a custom Queue extension, or both.

        Parameters:
        auth - the CallbackAuthorization identifying the callback
        oldResponder - the RPCResponder to convert into a callback notifier
        Returns:
        a CallbackNotifier created from the given responder

      • run

        public void run()
        The main processing loop for this RPCListener. This method continuously polls its server socket for new incoming connections and spawns RPCResponder instances for each one.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        shuts down this responder
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class AbstractRPCConnection

      • queueCallbackNotification

        public boolean queueCallbackNotification​(PibBlock message)
        Adds the given event to the output queue for transmission to the client via the registered clientCallback interface.
        Returns:
        true if a callback queue is registered and the message was queued

      • isCallbackEnabled
